snippet: The Mosque-Cathedral of Córdoba is often portrayed as a symbol of coexistence between Muslims and Catholics, but recently the site has become the subject of a dispute.
abstract: Cordoba Journal; site of the Mosque-Cathedral of Cordoba, Spain, has become subject of dispute over its management and ownership by the Roman Catholic Church; dispute has laid bare a more complicated history of the building, which is often portrayed as symbol of coexistence between Muslims and Catholics.
lead_paragraph: The Mosque-Cathedral of Córdoba is often portrayed as a symbol of coexistence between Muslims and Catholics, but recently the site has become the subject of a dispute.

headline.seo: Mosque-Cathedral of Spain at Center of Debate Over its Religious History
headline.main: Seeking to Renew Balance in a Site’s Dual History
headline.print_headline: Seeking to Renew Balance in a Site’s Dual History
